creditline: Gift of Elizabeth and Willard Clark in celebration of the 100th anniversary of Minneapolis Institute of Arts
description: round form with three lines that double back on themselves in "S" shapes; bronze, gold and black with square shell inlay; round form is brown with a wood texture
image_copyright: © Copyright 2009 Sakurako Matsushima. All Rights Reserved.
medium: Lacquer, hemp cloth, gold powder, gold leaf, silver leaf, shell
text: Matsushima Sakurako attended Tokyo University of the Arts and is today Professor at Utsunomiya University in Tochigi Prefecture. Since 1989 she has exhibited her work, which ranges from sculptures to large, wearable body ornaments. These three works show her versatility in materials, from works made just of bamboo and lacquer to highly decorated and delicate wall installations.
title: Undercurrents 2009-II
